title: Subpart 80-2 - REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTIFICATES IN THE CLASSROOM TEACHING SERVICE APPLIED AND QUALIFIED FOR ON OR BEFORE FEBRUARY 1, 2004, THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPERVISORY SERVICE APPLIED FOR ON OR BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1, 2006, AND THE PUPIL PERSONNEL SERVICE (EXCEPT FOR CERTIFICATES FOR SCHOOL COUNSELING APPLIED AND QUALIFIED FOR ON OR AFTER FEBRUARY 2, 2023)
content:
Subpart 80-2 - REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTIFICATES IN THE CLASSROOM TEACHING SERVICE APPLIED AND QUALIFIED FOR ON OR BEFORE FEBRUARY 1, 2004, THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPERVISORY SERVICE APPLIED FOR ON OR BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1, 2006, AND THE PUPIL PERSONNEL SERVICE (EXCEPT FOR CERTIFICATES FOR SCHOOL COUNSELING APPLIED AND QUALIFIED FOR ON OR AFTER FEBRUARY 2, 2023)

State Regulations
§ 80-2.1 - Application of this Subpart and definitions
§ 80-2.2 - General requirements
§ 80-2.3 - Certificates valid for pupil personnel service (school attendance teacher, school counselor, school dental hygiene teacher, school nurse-teacher, school psychologist and school social worker)
§ 80-2.4 - Certificates valid for administrative and supervisory service (school district administrator, and school administrator and supervisor and school business administrator)
§ 80-2.5 - Certificate valid for teaching occupational subjects
§ 80-2.6 - Certificates valid for teaching special education, the deaf and hearing-impaired, the blind and partially sighted, the speech- and hearing-handicapped
§ 80-2.7 - Certificate valid for reading teacher
§ 80-2.8 - Certificates valid for school media specialist, school media specialist (library), school media specialist (educational communications)
§ 80-2.9 - Certificates valid for bilingual education
§ 80-2.10 - Certificate valid for teaching English to speakers of other languages in the prekindergarten, elementary and secondary grades
§ 80-2.11 - Repealed
§ 80-2.12 - Certificate valid for teaching common branch subjects in the lower (PreK-3) and upper (4-6) elementary grades (PreK-6)
§ 80-2.13 - Certificate valid for teaching English, a language other than English, mathematics, a science, and social studies in grades 7-12
§ 80-2.14 - Certificates valid for teaching a special subject

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
